answers.answer: Per my PCP, I take my Metformin after my tests. Ask your doctor what he/she prefers.
Yes, I take metformin after the test. But does that mean I do not take metformin the day before? When is the last time you take metformin before the exam?

No stoppage, I continue with my daily schedule as I do a fasting glucose test and an A1c test. The former every 2 months, the latter every 3 months.Are testing your glucose with a home meter? What are your glucose levels preprandial [b4 breakfast] and postprandial [2-3 hrs after a meal]? If your levels remain elevated above normal do not stop the Metformin. If you have normal fasting levels [preprandial] and normal postprandial levels notify your doctor of your intentions to stop Metformin 72 hrs prior to the test. Do NOT stop unless your doctor authorizes you to do so.

I do not want metformin to mask/change my glucose/insulin numbers
